summary: Wolfgang Paul  was a German professor awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1989.
full_text: Wolfgang Paul  was a German physicist, who co-developed the non-magnetic quadrupole mass filter which laid the foundation for what we now call an ion trap. He shared one-half of the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1989 for this work with Hans Georg Dehmelt; the other half of the Prize in that year was awarded to Norman Foster Ramsey, Jr.
title: Wolfgang Paul
